comment: Super easy class! Every week was either a 2-page essay or a discussion post with just one required reply. I got 100s on everything without much stress. As long as you do the work on time and follow instructions, you'll do great. Highly recommend if you're looking for a chill and manageable course.

Each week was either a DB or Essay. The class is so easy, but he takes until the end of the semester. He gave 100 on everything. No EXAMs. Midterm and final are papers. It says it uses turn it in grader but I used chat GPT for all my papers and got a 100 on everything. you will need the book to cite sources.

I forgot to do course evaluations, so I'll give my honest opinion here. The course was easy but so useless. The teacher only assigned essays and discussions every week, which was a massive waste of time and $$$. Take this class for an easy grade, but you learn nothing. It's disappointing what education from professors at KSU has come to now.
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Very easy and straighforward class. You will have either a discussion post or 2 page essay to write each week. No quizzes or test. There is a short essay for midterm and final. As long as you complete assignments, you should get an A. I got a 100 on every essay.

Prof. Shinholster was absolutely great throughout the semester! You have 9 total essays to write (one is the midterm and the other is the final), chapters to read, and discussion posts. My favorite? NO GROUP PROJECT. This guy was great and would definitely take him again.
Interesting lectures, caring and understanding professor. Only graded by a few things (a few quizzes and a group project). Easy A
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Todd is a great guy and very knowledgeable prof. The class has 3 test and 2 projects that are fun and relevant. Does not take antendance but class is fun and interesting. Show up and read the articles for test and I got an A.

Easily the professor I've had this semester. From the very start of the class he makes it clear what he expects from you. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he makes it worth coming to class. He does do group projects, but he's very understanding if there's a problem with the group. I definitely would take him again!

He gives no feedback on assignments , is not respectful to differing opinions, is often absent, he has taken over 3 months to give grades back, and he does not  put in half as much effort as he expects students to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a very nice guy who really cares about what he teaches. Only a little annoyed with him because I ended up with an 89 in his class and he wouldn't bump me up. Most likely would take again though.

Communicates what is expected of you for assignments and tests. Tries his best to help you succeed without completely giving you an easy A. You have to work for your grade, but go to class and he'll probably help you get there.

Todd was awesome. Expect to read to participate in group discussions. Life happens and he totally gets it. Very helpful with make up work or tests. Very interesting and knows his stuff. One of my favorite professors.

Hes the best. He really wants you to succeed but hes not going to put in any more effort then you do. He gives tons of chances for you to make up a grade or submit something you didn't as long as you communicate with him. He understands that life happens but will not we walked over. He gives great advice and has lots of life experience. Hes awesome

Todd's the man. His lectures are very enjoyable and the fact that he is teaching for the fun of it makes it even better. Tests are hard, group projects are easy, and very few grades. Though attendance wasn't necessary, I strongly recommend attending his class. You won't be bored.

Todd is really helpful; he definitely wants his students to succeed. There are 3 tests and 2 projects. He seems to grade fairly easy on the project as long as you put in the effort. Be sure to read before tests, as they are tough.

Great great great teacher. Take him. He doesn't let you slack on the class but I found his class super enjoyable and looking forward to it. He really makes you think and encourages group discussions. He's interested and there to help and he's great. Take him, you won't regret it.

Todd is a fantastic teacher. He delves into world wide matters and really opens up your mind. It's amazing. His tests, though, are a bit tricky and you really need to properly study if you want to pass. you cannot BS it.

Funny teacher, easy assignments but HARD TESTS. Only 2 tests, midterm and final so worth more overall. But if you do well on other assignments, can still make an A in class. Overall, not a fun class but he made it almost enjoyable.
Great teacher, one of my favorites. easy material, especially if you took econ or similar courses in high school.

Todd's great! His class is pretty interesting if you like to know whats happening in the world. Class consists of 2 tests: midterm & final. 2 larger papers, one with a presentation, and then 2 smaller 2-page paper. Attendance is not mandatory but you should go. Todds pretty helpful when asked for help. Easily get an A.

He is very focused on talking about how everyone should develop their own opinions about the world around them, but goes on to then put down others when they DO have an opinion different from his own.

Best part of class is that he cancels it often. Passionate teacher but the midterm and final are complete multiple choice memorization questions that you will probably average a C on because the articles the class is based on are so boring and hard to remember. Todd also likes to insert his right wing politics into his lectures. O.K. class.

Todd is an awesome professor. I really looked forward to his class. Read the articles in the textbook and participate in class discussion. He is very understanding, as long as you are putting effort into your work and project. Midterm and a final. Study and you will do great. He was my favorite prof of the semester. Really challenges you to think.

Todd is a very nice guy and he understands if you turn things in late. He is very helpful and often accepts late work. If you're a slacker though, take the original KSU seminar because he actually cares about this class which is nice. Expect to learn things! Great guy, would recommend him

I LOVED this class.  Todd also makes it worth going, he is and probably will forever be the best prof I have ever had.  He really makes you think about who you are and why you are here.  The class was a breeze if you studied and had fun with the projects.  He wants you to think and explore creative options. The material is great and he makes it fun

Great Professor. Makes you think outside of the box. He cancels some days of class which is great. All the quizzes were online and the test where just the EXACT same questions from the quizzes. 2 major projects at the end. Overall good professor. You will make an A if you just do your work.

Inspiring person, wants you to succeed and find meaning in life. It's hard for me to imagine a better instructor for this course. My friends complained about their KSU classes, but I actually looked forward to mine. Absolutely Recommend.
His class is easy just do all the assignments. The stuff he talks about in class is interesting and really helps when you take the quiz. Definitely take his class if can.

Cool teacher at first but as semester passed it became clear anytime he told you an assignment was going to be due it simply would never be up. There was never clear direction on anything everyday was a guessing game. I do not recommend this professor.

Awesome teacher. Fun, carefree and hardworking. He taught in a way you could understand and all quizzes were online. Have a couple of projects but are definately worth the grade. He is out of town a lot and may procrastinate but he makes up for it always. I suggest him as a teacher.

Awesome Prof! I was not interested at all in this class, but it soon became my favorite class! I loved it! Definitely made me wish there was another class to continue learning from. I have a new way of seeing the world. Very intriguing! Would recommend him to all! Make sure you understand everything on the syllabus and you'll do fine!

He is not a good professor to choose, unless you want your professor to be out most of the time, not post quizzes, assignments or grades when he says he is going to.  He is pretty cool as a person but not recommended as a professor because he would rather be friends. He doesn't care about your grade more than you or even an equal amount as you.
Great teacher, just as long as you do the quizes and read the articles you'll be fine.

Pretty good professor, teaches you things you'll need outside of an educational institution. Involves current events into the class. Does travel often and sometimes class is cancelled, but it's not more than 3-4 times. Also doesn't post things when he says he will, but mostly just quizzes, which no one complains about...

Todd was my favorite teacher this semester!  He is super nice and casual, and his lectures are always interesting.  If you have a scheduling issue or an emergency, he is very willing to help you in any way.  I learned a lot from his class without even realizing it.  I would take him again in a heartbeat!  AWESOME person.

This teacher is an absolutely HORRRIBLE teacher! He will try to be your best friend one second and your worst enemy the next moment. He is inconsistent and never posts things when he says he will. Don't bother showing up because he is probably in Miami or Vegas for one of his other jobs.

The best professor offered to teach this course. Goes beyond the material to make class interesting and relatable to current issues in the world. Explains to you how you can make a difference in the world. Cool person and great teacher. If you pay attention, easy A.
real helpful throughout his class

Todd is the best choice you can make for a first year seminar class.He makes coming to class something to look forward to and always has great lessons in store. As others have said, the online quizzes are a down side to the class, but compared to all the busy work other professors would throw at you, theyre welcome, if you actually try youll get100

Todd's Class teaches you about awareness in the world and he teaches from a non-traditional approach and class is fun. He is a understanding teacher, If you missed the deadline for a quiz, or essay he will cut you slack. Todd is a great person, i recommend his class. This is one class i would not mind taking again, and that says a lot. Take it :)

Every week there are quizzes based on multiple articles and videos that are very difficult. He talks about applying the information when the quizzes are just regurgitating the article. All of the work was either out of class or online. Todd rarely uploads grades. He also changed his final at the last minute to an essay.

Professor preaches about "real" learning not memorizing. Then proceeds to give peck and hunt quizzes. Schedule was constantly changing and unclear. Never did any real work in class, just online. Decent guy, but not the professor this site hypes him up to be. Quizzes are unfair and incomprehensible. Mid-term included questions we never had before.
Todd was a great professor. He was by far the most down to earth professor I had, and he seemed to actually care about his students and was passionate about the class. I highly recommend this course.
Todd is the best professor at Kennesaw State University. Get you some him.
They say in college you get that one professor that shows you who you want to be. Point Blank... Here he is. You need this class.
They say in college you get that one professor that shows you what direction you want to go in life. Point blank... Here he is. Don't wait. Find out who you are now.

Todd was one of the best professors I've had this semester. As a required freshman seminar class, I thought I would be learning tools for studying and stuff like that, but it was nothing even close. He informed us about things going on the world that are affecting us every day that I had no idea about. I would recommend this class to every freshman

One of the greatest professors I've had. Was never really bored in class. He wants everyone to do well. It isn't an easy "A" however if you just put forth a little bit of effort its not really hard. There is extra credit and a bunch of different things graded. I would say take him if you can.
Very interesting to listen to! I could listen to him talk about world issues all day! very cool guy

TODD IS AWESOME!!! He is always available to talk whether you have questions about the class or just need someone to listen to you vent. His class can be tough at times but you learn a LOT! He is VERY passionate about what he is teaching and it shows! He doesn't hold back and hates being "politically correct" which is AWESOME! LOVE HIM!!!!

Todd is the man. He teaches everything with complete clarity and has a great understanding of how people learn things differently. Great Professor!! Looking forward to taking his social entrepreneur class next fall!!

Great teacher.  His lectures are very interesting and powerpoints are posted online.  3 tests, 1 group presentation, 2 papers and a few other assignments.  Todd is definitely the professor you want for KSU 1101.  Do the work and you will get an A.

He is one of the best professor's I have ever had. He is down to earth, extremely knowledgeable, and more than anything very personable.  I don't think KSU could have chosen a better professor for this course. He makes you excited about life currently and your future!
This is the best teacher at this school. He helps inside and outside of the classroom. He truely cares about each student. Take Todd's class, you will not regret it.

He is the Best teacher ive ever had!Truly cares about his students and is very passionate about what he teaches.Class is not mandatory, and i wouldnt buy the book.notes are on powerpoints.2 or 3 tests and a final exam. no pop quizes. A very easy and enjoyable class.I Would forsure reccomend taking him!

This guy... This guy is great! He has help me so much not just in the classroom but also in the outside world. He prepairs you for the rest for your time in school and for the rest of your life! Take this class if your a freshman!
Such a great teacher! Hilarious and fun!

Todd (that's what he goes by) is probably one of the most rocking individuals to grace the face of the earth. I've heard from most of my friends that their KSU 1101 professors are dull and boring, but Todd is quite contrary. He talks about issues that matter, and encourages you to be passionate about something. Do not miss out on taking him.
Very nice and helpful. Interesting lessons, great humor. Tests are multiple choice, but can be tricky. Recommended!
